body: @wolfstudy @codelipenghui please help review this pull request
mac os artifacts have not been published yet.
Tests are coming in  the next commit.
Got it, thank you for your reminder. I'll update those in 2.4.1 folders as well.

@yjshen thanks for your technical guidance.

I've incorporated your comments, could you PTAL?
I have filled a github issue, pls see also: https://github.com/apache/pulsar/issues/5136

@grantwwu @sijie We can introduce `godoc` in the go client to automatically generate the interface code and related examples we need.

For example: https://godoc.org/github.com/apache/pulsar-client-go
When I navigate to the link https://pulsar.apache.org/docs/en/2.2.1/standalone/ , it shows content of v2.2.1. So has this issue been fixed?
But there is a premise, we need to follow the go community related code specifications, I suggest to add the relevant check tool: `gofmt`, `golint`, `goimport` and so on.

I've just checked the two links, they navigate to the right destination now.
@ivankelly Could we close this issue?
Does Pulsar support the requirement from @ngjaying now?
I will try to add more documents to fix these problems.
cc @sijie. BTW, would you help to update the PIP wiki, some typos fixed and header supplemented, check out [here](https://gist.github.com/yittg/56c6dedf7509f634ec7effc4f6f3631d).
it runs fine for me , are you saying it runs for a while and then quits ?

keeps running for me, probably something to do with your hosts file, but don't see any problems locally.
debian 10 has open jdk 11 as default , we will decide to move that as default jvm also as part of the move.
Thanks for your quick reply. I'll work on the docker image then.

run java8 tests
run integration tests
@Jennifer88huang I don't think they are resolving to the right version of javadoc
Then who can resolve this issue correctly?

the off chance, someone else has the same issue. I resolved it by:
- moving to openjdk8(may not be required. but it exposed the issue with a better error message than the default mac java 8, I think)
- add `127.0.0.1       <laptop name>.local` to `/etc/hosts` or whatever name it errors out on your laptop
- `dscacheutil -flushcache`

Thanks for comment. That's right, then we'll also need to do the check when user try to adjust the partition size later if we allow creation of non partition topic with name like my-topic-name-partition-123. 
I was trying to make the rule easier by just not allowing that. If we think it could be useful to allow creation of such topic I can make the change.
Yes, I have to encode my data by using avro lib. Thanks!
closed as the question is answered

I have added the unit tests for newly introduced classes.
@codelipenghui @jiazhai @merlimat I have addressed all the comments. PTAL

This image is the `PersistentDispatcherMultipleConsumers` instance which has the topic from heap dump.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15376628/64578317-069f6d00-d3ba-11e9-862f-d7463ae47ce6.png)

Delivery of messages to consumers resumes when `unload` executes.
So, there might be hints in `unload`.
